paper.title: Computing Stable and Partial Stable Models of Extended Disjunctive Logic Programs
paper.abstract: In [Prz91], Przymusinski introduced the partial (or 3-valued) stable model semantics which extends the (2-valued) stable model semantics defined originally by Gelfond and Lifschitz [GL88]. In this paper we describe a procedure to compute the collection of all partial stable models of an extended disjunctive logic program. This procedure consists in transforming an extended disjunctive logic program into a constrained disjunctive program free of negation-by-default whose set of 2-valued minimal models corresponds to the set of partial stable models of the original program.
